and gruelling war in Britain's history.

2958.text:
Few generals came out of it with their reputations
intact.

2962.text:
Whilst he had no doubt made many mistakes,
in particular showing too much deference to

2967.text:
Haig, his views on both strategy and tactics
had been ultimately vindicated.

2971.text:
And it is by this that his time as Chief of
the Imperial General Staff should be judged.

2976.text:
(There's another fine caricature showing what
a big character he was.)
